name: Modern Dark
description: A polished dark theme with violet accents, optimized for developer tools and dashboards. Clean, minimal aesthetic with excellent contrast and readability.

fontFamily.sans: var(--font-geist-sans), ui-sans-serif, system-ui, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Roboto, "Helvetica Neue", Arial, sans-serif
fontFamily.mono: var(--font-geist-mono), ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, "SF Mono", Menlo, Consolas, "Liberation Mono", monospace

button.name: Button
button.description: Interactive button component for user actions. Use primary for main CTAs, secondary for less prominent actions.

asChild.description: Render as child element using Radix Slot

do: Use primary variant for the main action on a page
Include an icon for clarity when space allows
Use descriptive action verbs (Save, Create, Delete)
Disable button while action is processing
dont: Use multiple primary buttons in the same section
Use ghost buttons for important actions
Make buttons too wide (max-width recommended)
Use vague labels like "Click here" or "Submit"

card.name: Card
card.description: Container component for grouping related content with consistent styling.
card.usage:
```tsx import { Card, CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, CardContent, CardFooter } from '@/components/ui/card'; Account Settings Manage your account preferences

Your settings content here...

 ```

do: Use cards to group related information
Include a clear title when content needs context
Use consistent padding within cards
Add hover states for interactive cards
dont: Nest cards within cards
Use cards for single pieces of information
Mix bordered and non-bordered cards in the same view

badge.name: Badge
badge.description: Small label component for status indicators, counts, or categories.
badge.usage:
```tsx
import { Badge } from '@/components/ui/badge';

// Status indicators
<Badge>Active</Badge>
<Badge variant="secondary">Pending</Badge>
<Badge variant="destructive">Failed</Badge>

// With custom colors
<Badge className="bg-blue-500/10 text-blue-400 border-blue-500/20">
  In Progress
</Badge>
```

do: Use badges for status indicators
Keep badge text short (1-2 words)
Use consistent colors for the same status across the app
dont: Use badges for primary actions
Put long text in badges
Use too many badge variants in one view

input.name: Input
input.description: Text input field for user data entry.
input.usage:
```tsx import { Input } from '@/components/ui/input'; import { Label } from '@/components/ui/label';
```

do: Always include a label for accessibility
Use appropriate input types (email, password, etc.)
Provide helpful placeholder text
Show validation errors clearly
dont: Use placeholder as a substitute for labels
Use generic "Enter value" placeholders
Hide error messages on focus

progress.name: Progress
progress.description: Visual progress indicator for loading states or completion percentages.
progress.usage:
```tsx import { Progress } from '@/components/ui/progress'; // Basic progress // With label
Upload progress 45%
```

do: Show percentage text alongside progress bar
Use appropriate sizes for context (h-1.5 for inline, h-3 for prominent)
Animate progress changes smoothly
dont: Use for unknown duration tasks (use spinner instead)
Hide progress indicators when task completes - show success state

tabs.name: Tabs
tabs.description: Navigation component for switching between related views.
tabs.usage:
```tsx
import { Tabs, TabsList, TabsTrigger, TabsContent } from '@/components/ui/tabs';

<Tabs defaultValue="overview">
  <TabsList>
    <TabsTrigger value="overview">Overview</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="settings">Settings</TabsTrigger>
    <TabsTrigger value="activity">Activity</TabsTrigger>
  </TabsList>
  <TabsContent value="overview">
    Overview content...
  </TabsContent>
  <TabsContent value="settings">
    Settings content...
  </TabsContent>
  <TabsContent value="activity">
    Activity content...
  </TabsContent>
</Tabs>
```

do: Use tabs for switching between related content
Keep tab labels short and descriptive
Show active tab clearly
dont: Use more than 5-6 tabs (consider dropdown or sidebar)
Use tabs for sequential steps (use stepper instead)
Mix icons and text inconsistently

dialog.name: Dialog
dialog.description: Modal overlay for focused interactions that require user attention.
dialog.usage:
```tsx
import {
  Dialog,
  DialogContent,
  DialogDescription,
  DialogHeader,
  DialogTitle,
  DialogTrigger,
  DialogFooter,
} from '@/components/ui/dialog';

<Dialog>
  <DialogTrigger asChild>
    <Button>Open Dialog</Button>
  </DialogTrigger>
  <DialogContent>
    <DialogHeader>
      <DialogTitle>Edit Profile</DialogTitle>
      <DialogDescription>
        Make changes to your profile here.
      </DialogDescription>
    </DialogHeader>
    {/* Dialog body content */}
    <DialogFooter>
      <Button variant="outline">Cancel</Button>
      <Button>Save</Button>
    </DialogFooter>
  </DialogContent>
</Dialog>
```

do: Use dialogs for important actions requiring confirmation
Include a clear title and description
Provide cancel/close options
Focus the first interactive element on open
dont: Use dialogs for simple messages (use toast instead)
Stack multiple dialogs
Use dialogs for long forms (use a page instead)

select.name: Select
select.description: Dropdown selection component for choosing from a list of options.
select.usage:
```tsx
import {
  Select,
  SelectContent,
  SelectItem,
  SelectTrigger,
  SelectValue,
} from '@/components/ui/select';

<Select>
  <SelectTrigger className="w-[180px]">
    <SelectValue placeholder="Select status" />
  </SelectTrigger>
  <SelectContent>
    <SelectItem value="pending">Pending</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="in-progress">In Progress</SelectItem>
    <SelectItem value="completed">Completed</SelectItem>
  </SelectContent>
</Select>
```

do: Use for 4+ options (use radio for fewer)
Include a placeholder or default value
Sort options logically (alphabetical, by frequency, etc.)
dont: Use for binary choices (use switch/checkbox)
Include too many options (consider search/autocomplete)

scrollArea.name: ScrollArea
scrollArea.description: Custom scrollable container with styled scrollbars.

do: Use for long lists or content areas
Set explicit height/width
Consider virtualization for very long lists
dont: Use for short content that fits without scrolling
Nest scroll areas

tooltip.name: Tooltip
tooltip.description: Contextual information popup that appears on hover.
tooltip.usage:
```tsx import { Tooltip, TooltipContent, TooltipProvider, TooltipTrigger, } from '@/components/ui/tooltip';

This is helpful information

 ```

do: Use for supplementary information
Keep tooltip text short
Wrap app in TooltipProvider
dont: Put essential information only in tooltips
Use tooltips on touch devices as primary info
Include interactive elements in tooltips

guidelines:
# Modern Dark Design System Guidelines

## Overview
This design system is optimized for developer tools and dashboards. It uses a dark color scheme with purple accents for a modern, professional appearance.

## Color Usage

### Primary Colors
- **Primary (Purple)**: Use for main interactive elements, CTAs, and active states
- **Secondary (Dark Gray)**: Use for secondary buttons and less prominent elements
- **Destructive (Red)**: Use sparingly for dangerous or destructive actions

### Semantic Colors
- **Background**: Very dark (`oklch(0.10 0 0)`) for main app background
- **Card**: Slightly lighter (`oklch(0.15 0 0)`) for elevated surfaces
- **Muted**: For disabled states and secondary text
- **Border**: Subtle borders that don't distract

### Status Colors
- **Success (Green)**: Completed, passed, active states
- **Warning (Amber)**: Pending, attention needed
- **Error (Red)**: Failed, errors, destructive
- **Info (Blue)**: Informational, in-progress

## Typography

### Font Stack
- **Sans**: Geist Sans for UI text
- **Mono**: Geist Mono for code and technical content

### Hierarchy
- **Headings**: Use semibold (600) or bold (700)
- **Body**: Use normal (400) or medium (500)
- **Labels**: Use text-sm with medium weight
- **Captions**: Use text-xs with muted-foreground

## Spacing

### Base Unit
All spacing uses a 4px base unit. Common values:
- **Tight**: 4px, 8px (gap-1, gap-2)
- **Normal**: 12px, 16px (gap-3, gap-4)
- **Loose**: 24px, 32px (gap-6, gap-8)

### Component Padding
- **Buttons**: px-4 py-2 (16px horizontal, 8px vertical)
- **Cards**: p-4 or p-6 (16px or 24px all sides)
- **Inputs**: px-3 py-2 (12px horizontal, 8px vertical)

## Border Radius

Use consistent border radius:
- **Small elements** (badges, chips): rounded-sm
- **Medium elements** (buttons, inputs): rounded-md
- **Large elements** (cards, modals): rounded-lg
- **Full round** (avatars, circular buttons): rounded-full

## Shadows

Use shadows sparingly in dark mode:
- **Subtle elevation**: shadow-sm
- **Cards/Modals**: shadow-md to shadow-lg
- **Glow effects**: Use primary color with low opacity for focus states

## Transitions

All interactive elements should have smooth transitions:
- **Duration**: 150ms for micro-interactions, 200ms for normal, 300ms for larger changes
- **Easing**: Use cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1) for most transitions

## Accessibility

### Color Contrast
- Maintain 4.5:1 contrast ratio for normal text
- Maintain 3:1 contrast ratio for large text and UI elements

### Focus States
- All interactive elements must have visible focus indicators
- Use the ring color (purple) with ring-2 or ring-[3px]

### Keyboard Navigation
- All interactive elements must be keyboard accessible
- Use logical tab order
- Provide skip links for long pages

## Animation Guidelines

### Micro-interactions
- Button hover: subtle color change + shadow
- Card hover: border highlight + slight shadow increase
- Input focus: ring appearance with transition

### Loading States
- Use animate-spin for spinners
- Use animate-pulse for skeleton loading
- Use Progress component for determinate loading

### Status Indicators
- Use animate-pulse for "in progress" states
- Avoid excessive animation that distracts from content
